subject: VAM PRO issues
description_text:
Hello,

I have issues with my vam pro connected with pro x ultra.

just to be clear , i didn’t use both simsonn manager and simub at same
time.

I solved most of the issues by updating the Simsonn Manager firmware and
very important thing is to NOT importing the previous pedals profile i have
created from the old version.

However, one issue still remains. When more than two effects are enabled in
SimHub, the haptic motors lose connection — it switches from “Connected” to
“Searching Device.” After that, the motors keep vibrating without stopping,
and I have to unplug all cables and power to reset everything.

It looks like the motors can’t handle more than two simhub effects at once
. Could you please check if this problem will be fixed in a future update
or if there is a fixe ?

I read other people having the same issue on reddit website. So I presume
you are aware of this problem.

I really like the hardware, but this issue makes it difficult to enjoy the
experience

thanks

conversations.body_text: Hi，Cayme，    Are you currently using SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2? Also, please confirm that your firmware has been updated to CPU1: 2.0.5 / CPU2: 2.0.4.  You mentioned two effects in SimHub — could you tell us which ones exactly, and in which game you experienced this issue? Have you tried running SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2 alone for telemetry without SimHub?  Please make sure that your pedal’s USB cable is connected directly to a rear USB 3.0 (blue) port, not through a USB hub, as insufficient power could cause disconnections. Try turning off all lighting on the ProX Ultra and test again with SimHub — if the disconnects stop, that confirms it’s a power supply issue.  Also, please share the Reddit post link you mentioned so we can review it. If the issue appears to come from SimHub, please send us a compressed copy of the log folder from your SimHub installation directory — we’ll work with the SimHub team to investigate and resolve it.

Hello,

I believe I may have solved the disconnection problem.

Before, my setup was split across two wall outlets — the Simsonn control
box and the ground cable were connected to a different wall outlet in my
room.
Now, I have connected everything to the same power strip, which itself is
plugged into a single wall outlet.

On this power strip, I have my PC, speakers, Moza R9 base, Simsonn control
box, and my homemade ground cable.
The ground cable starts from the power strip, goes to a screw on one of the
pedals, and from there I plan to add a second ground wire to connect the
pedal screw to my Moza R9 base for extra safety and better grounding.

I also disconnected the USB isolator, because it was causing more
instability instead of helping.

So far, everything looks much more stable — I was able to complete a longer
driving session than before with all four effects enabled.
If the disconnection issue happens again, we can schedule another ToDesk
session depending on your availability.

Fingers crossed it keeps working! and thanks for your patience

Best regards,

Hello,
update 2

I performed some continuity tests on my Simsonn control box and noticed
something interesting:
When I touch two screws on the metal case, I get continuity (beep) —
meaning the case is properly conductive.
However, when I touch the metal frame of the USB port and one of the case
screws, there is no continuity.

This means that the USB shield is not connected to the chassis ground.
If that’s the case, the USB port housing is floating electrically, which
could explain why the box loses USB connection randomly due to EMI or
ground potential differences.

I also read a Reddit post from another user who found the same issue.
He said he solved it by adding a small wire (soldered somewhere inside the
box) to connect the USB port shield to the metal case — but he clearly
mentioned it was “at your own risk”.

Please be sure to also read my previous message.

Last update :

Hello,

I have run extensive tests to isolate the issue with my Simsonn Pro X Ultra
+ VAM Pro.
The problem still occurs and seems to come from the control box (USB
stability / shielding or internal grounding).

✅ *Actions already tested*

- PC & power

- PC is brand-new (3 months old)

- PC grounded properly (Corsair RMx PSU)

- Tried with and without ground cable between PC and rig

- Direct wall outlet, no power strip issues

- Tested with and without external USB hub (better without hub)

- USB isolator tested → no improvement


*USB & cables*

- Cable routed far from all power wires and rig frame

- Tried different USB ports (USB 2.0 & 3.0 rear ports)

- No other devices near the Simsonn USB cable

- Windows USB power saving options disabled

- USB selective suspend disabled

- Firmware reinstalled multiple times (manual & auto)


*Rig / EMI tests*

- Box placed on ground on foam (not touching rig / metal)

- Box moved away as far as possible

- Pedals bridged to control box ground

- Pedal frame isolated with nylon screws and washers

- Tested with Moza base completely powered off and disconnected

- Tested with only 2, 3 or 4 effects in SimHub → same result

- Random disconnects or signal freeze after some minutes under load


*Multimeter tests*

- All rig / wheel base / pedals points ground-checked

- NOTE: USB shield of the control box does NOT beep / does not connect to
case metal
→ possible shield / grounding issue inside the box?


❗ *Symptoms*

- Works for a few minutes then pedal signal freezes or disconnects

- Behavior worse when heat increases or USB noise rises

- With identical setup, only Simsonn device has this issue

- Other USB devices 100% stable


? *Conclusion*

I have eliminated:

- PC issues

- Power issues

- Ground loop issues

- USB cable routing & EMI placement issues

- Windows usb power management issues

- Hub/port issues


The only remaining possibility is a defective control box (USB interface or
internal ground/shield problem).

✅ Request

Please check and arrange a replacement control box under warranty, or
provide next steps for diagnostic.

Thank you very much.
